items.title: Apple mulls more India-made iPhones for US to avoid China tariffs: Report
items.description: The Cupertino-based tech major is looking to implement the plan as a temporary measure to offset the high cost of imports due to the tariffs imposed on Beijing

items.title: Titan Company: Will the financials glitter?
items.description: The company continues to see strong demand for jewellery, despite the sharp increase in gold prices. The market shift towards the organised segment is also beneficial for large organised jewellery companies like Titan

items.title: Should investors bet on banking stocks as credit growth moderates?
items.description: Growth in personal loans has fallen off the cliff while growth in gold loans has surged

items.title: Trent: What should investors do after a disappointing Q4?
items.description: The SSSG, a key performance parameter, is showing moderation over the past two quarters

items.title: Godrej Consumer: Volume revival, stable margins on the cards
items.description: Under-penetrated categories, rural expansion could unlock growth

items.title: Blackstone & Warburg Pincus may join other early-stage suitors as Ontario Teachers launches sale of Sahyadri Hospitals
items.description: As part of its first control private equity buyout in India, in August 2022, OTPP  acquired a significant majority stake in Sahyadri Hospitals from the Everstone Group

items.title: PAG picks JP Morgan and Morgan Stanley as advisors for mega sale of controlling stake in Nuvama Wealth Management
items.description: PAG entered Nuvama Wealth Management in 2021, and the latter was listed on the bourses in 2023, following a restructuring process. The firm's share price has doubled since its market debut

items.title: Novo preparing for early launch of weight-loss drug Wegovy in India
items.description: Novo and Lilly have seen skyrocketing global demand for their innovative weight-loss drugs, with investor interest also boosting the drugmakers to among the world's most valuable companies.

items.title: Lifestyle diseases striking younger in India warns Apollo Hospitals new report
items.description: The comprehensive study draws insights from de-identified electronic medical records encompassing over 2.5 million preventive health screenings conducted across Apollo’s vast ecosystem of hospitals, clinics, and diagnostic centres between 2019 and 2024.
